question: Hwa mæg eaðost ða duru ontynan - Who may #### open the door?
explanation: Here 'eaðe' is in its superlative form so it is translated as 'most easily'

question: Hie ða burh mihton eaðe begitan - They might #### take the city
Hie ferdon swa wide landes swa hie faran mihton - They traveled as #### as they could travel
explanation: Here 'wide' can be translated as 'far' or 'wide'

question: He ferde feorr and wide geond middangeard - He went far ond #### throughout the earth
Se man wæs wel donde on eallum þingum — He was #### done in all things
Hie mihton wel habban wif on ðæm dagum — They might #### take a wife on this day
Faraþ ond axiaþ geornlice be ðæm cilde — Go and ask #### about the child
explanation: Here 'geornlice' can be translated as 'earnestly' or 'eagerly'

question: Ðæt he geornlicost God weorþige — That he #### worships God
explanation: Here 'geornlice' is in its superlative form so it can be translated as 'most earnestly' or 'most eagerly'

question: Ælfric abbod gret freondlice Sigferd — Abbod Aelfric #### greets Sigferd
Witodlice ðæs monan trendel is symle gehal, þeah ðe eall endemes eallunga ne scine — Certainly the disc of the moon is always complete, though the whole of it does not #### shine
He wolde dearnunga mid mandadum menu beswican — He would #### deceive men with wicked deeds
Ic wiste ðæt ðu hwilon lufodest God — I thought that you #### loved God
explanation: Here 'hwilon' can be translated as 'formerly' or 'at one time'

question: Ic forþ heonun ðine gewitnesse wel geheolde — I should #### keep your testimony well
Ic mæg heonon geseon — I can see ####
Eall ðæt ðider com ðæt wæs ðone hæcce ond sume scrine ond sume roden — All that came #### was the crosier, some shrines, and some crucifixes
Ða se cyng ðæt hierde, þa wende he hine west — When the king heard that, #### he went west himeself
Ða he ealdode, þa clypode he his yldestan cniht him to — #### he was old, then he called his oldest child to him
